thread.title: Girl reunited with teddy thanks to kind airport staff
thread.title_full: Girl reunited with teddy thanks to kind airport staff

title: Girl reunited with teddy thanks to kind airport staff
text:
Girl reunited with teddy thanks to kind airport staff Last updated 09:49, October 5 2015 Toronto Pearson International Airport 
RaRa woke up in a drawer at the airport, but he was supposed to be on a plane with his family. 
A four year old girl has been reunited with her favourite teddy, thanks to the kindness of airport staff at Toronto's Pearson International Airport. 
RaRa's first stop was at security where he went through the scanners. Toronto Pearson International Airport/ Facebook 
Phoebe Steel and her family were returning home after a trip to the UK, when she realised she had left her beloved teddy RaRa at the airport. 
Although Phone's mum tried to calm her daughter, she was understandably upset. 
He took a moving sidewalk to get to his flight . Toronto Pearson International Airport/ Facebook 
"On the plane especially, I'm trying to explain we can't go back, it's not a car, right, you can't turn around," her mum, Jennifer Steel told CBCNews. 
Steel contacted the airport through Facebook, but admitted she thought RaRa was a "goner". 
But that couldn't have been further from the truth, in fact RaRa had been on an epic adventure of his own. 
He also made some new friends at the airport. Toronto Pearson International Airport/ Facebook 
Images posted to Facebook showed RaRa enjoying a ride through the airport scanner and making some new friends.
